summary:
I'm interested in projects working on inclusion and diversity, especially in the field of leisure and events. Experience research and - design for and especially with special groups is one of my focus points. 
Inspiring cases within the field of cultural venues (like pop venues, musea, theaters), creative hotspots and vibrant cities have also my attention. Which projects and organizations are making innovative connections and finding new solutions or (business) models? And in doing so, are they sustainable and better prepared for upcoming developments? 

Love my wife, kids and dog, waterpolo, Basque, music, arts, Africa and discovering cities.

profile_positions.description:
Editor, author, researcher.

Uncover started as a platform of research and projects on the field cultural and creative industries.  By analyzing cases and telling stories, we try to inspire, show future topics and connect the network towards new perspective, possibilities and challenges. In 2017 Uncover broadened its horizon to the entire leisure field.

Uncover production in connection to Colin (Creative Industries network):
- Uncover 1, Creative Hotspots (2007, Dutch 1500 copies)
- Uncover 2, Connected (2008, Dutch 1500 & English 1500 copies))
- Uncover 3, Social Design (2009, Dutch 1500 copies)

Book "European Capital of Culture - more than a year of celebration" (Horsten, De Wijs, Zegers) 
(2011, Dutch 1000 and English 1000 copies). In coop. 2018Eindhoven/Brabant & Collabor8 (Interreg)).

From 2013-2016 Uncover was published in cooperation with MMNieuws:
- Uncover/MMNieuws 1 Social Innovation (Dec 2013, Dutch, 1500 pieces)
- Uncover/MMNieuws 2 Multiple value creation at cultural venues (Dec 2014, Dutch, 1500 pieces)
- Uncover/MMNieuws 3 Cities in transition & leisure (Aug 2016, Dutch, 1500 pieces)

From 2017 Uncover became a publication of Academy for Leisure and Events. The focus from culture and creative industries shift to the leisure field.
- Uncover (1) The value of leisure (August 2017, 1000 pieces).
- Uncover (2) Leisure and events (August 2018, 1000 pieces)
- Uncover (3) Leisure for a better world (August 2019, 1000 pieces) 
- Uncover (4) Leisure and change (August 2020, 1000 pieces) 
- Uncover (5) Leisure in a bubble (August 2021, 1000 pieces)
- Uncover (6) Inclusive Leisure (August 2022, 1000 Pieces - Dec 2022 500 pieces English)
The articles are also published on platforms of Mestmag, NRIT, MMNieuws and BUAS and connected to expert meetings and conference.

company.name: Colin, Creative Organisations Linked In Networks

profile_positions.description:
- Founding Father in 2005
- 2006 opening offices in Blushuis (Breda) and Villa Media (Tilburg)
- Project manager Colin till 2013
- In 2013 Colin is integrated partly in Performatory, driver in social innovation and partly in the Track Cultural Venue Management, both within Breda University of Applied Sciences.

Colin, Creative Organizations Linked in Networks, is a network for creative organizations. Colin is a 'friend' which advices creative entrepreneurs. It invites creative entrepreneurs to show their work and participate in projects and network activities.

Colin makes networks visible, encourages entrepreneurship (in general and starters) and contributes to knowledge sharing between government, business and education. Through projects, meetings and toolkits, Colin inspires, informs and connects the network so it can collaborate to further the growth and professionalization of the creative industry in Breda and Tilburg, where we both had an agency in the hart of a creative cluster until 2011.

Together with a colleague I have set up Colin from NHTV (now BUAS), starting pioneering in 2005 (official opening in sept 2006). Colin obtained funds from the cities Breda (till 2010) and Tilburg (till 2010).
Consider Colin as a learning organization with a mix of professionals and students. For NHTV Colin was their outpost in their account management and action research on the field of creative industries. Later Colin moved to Leerfabriek KvL in Oisterwijk. 
Colin organized several successful concepts like My Ass, Vonk, Creative Marketplace and Talentpool 2018Eindhoven till 2013. In 2013 Colin as an organization stopped and got integrated in Performatory, driver in social innovation and a new department Cultural Venue Management (Breda University of Applied Sciences).
